sentences: Tal on lõunamaalase kuum süda, veri.
context: The Estonian word 'kuum' is an adjective that means 'hot' in English. It can refer to temperature (both literal and figurative), weather conditions, emotions, or intensity. The word has several declension forms including kuum (nominative singular), kuuma (genitive/partitive), kuumem (comparative), and kõige kuumem (superlative). Examples of its usage include describing hot weather, hot objects from a stove, and fiery personalities or emotions.
